findings.title: CO - Code Optimization
findings.description: There are code segments that could be optimized to reduce size, memory consumption, execution time, or number of operations.

findings.title: RSML - Redundant SafeMath Library
findings.description: The usage of SafeMath library adds complexity, overhead and increases unnecessarily the gas consumption since Solidity versions greater than or equal to 0.8.0 have native functionality that replaces it.

findings.title: L02 - State Variables could be Declared Constant
findings.description: State variables can be declared as constant using the constant keyword to ensure their values cannot be changed after being set, which decreases gas consumption.

findings.title: L04 - Conformance to Solidity Naming Conventions
findings.description: The code does not follow Solidity naming convention guidelines, which can decrease readability and maintainability.

findings.title: L06 - Missing Events Access Control
findings.description: The contract does not have proper access control for events, which could lead to issues.

findings.title: L13 - Divide before Multiply Operation
findings.description: It is important to be aware of the order of operations when performing arithmetic calculations. This is especially important when working with large numbers, as the order of operations can affect the final result of the calculation. Performing divisions before multiplications may cause loss of prediction.

findings.title: L22 - Potential Locked Ether
findings.description: The contract contains Ether that has been placed into a Solidity contract and is unable to be transferred. Thus, it is impossible to access the locked Ether. This may produce a financial loss for the users that have called the payable method.
